articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland unexpectedly resigned on Monday, saying she was no longer on the same page with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau about the best path forward for Canada.
articles.title: Canada's finance minister resigns after policy clash with PM Trudeau

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Defence Minister Boris Pistorius said on Monday his country would likely play a role in securing a future ceasefire deal between Russia and Ukraine but that it was far too early to tell what a peacekeeping force might look like.
articles.title: Berlin eyes role in Ukraine peace deal but says too early for decisions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Monday it was up to Syrians to determine their own future and called for an "inclusive" government taking account of the country's diverse ethnic and religious interests.
articles.title: Russia says Syrians must decide future of their country

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli technical team is in Doha for working-level talks with Qatari mediators on "remaining issues" in a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release deal, an official with knowledge of the talks told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli team in Doha talks on potential Gaza deal, official says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hussam Al-Masri
articles.description: Relatives of Palestinians killed by Israel in Khan Younis gathered around their white-shrouded bodies on Monday before carrying them to their graves.
articles.title: Palestinians mourn dead after Israeli strike on Gaza's Khan Younis

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: A juvenile student killed two people at a Wisconsin school before police found the suspect dead at the scene of the latest shooting to devastate a U.S. campus, authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: Three killed in Wisconsin school shooting, including shooter, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canada's government on Monday proposed C$1.3 billion ($913.05 million) for border security after U.S. President-elect Donald Trump threatened tariffs unless Canada reduced the movement of migrants and drugs into the United States.
articles.title: Canada announces new border funding after Trump tariff threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. State Department on Monday said there is no U.S. government organization on the ground currently for the search of Austin Tice, an American journalist who was taken captive during a reporting trip to Syria in August 2012, although it did not rule out the possibility.
articles.title: State Dept says no US government organization on the ground for the search of Austin Tice

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The family of a Turkish-born American human rights activist killed by Israel in the occupied West Bank pleaded with Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Monday for a U.S. probe into her killing but got no promises, the woman's husband said.
articles.title: Family of US activist killed in West Bank says Blinken offers no prospect of US inquiry

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Monday that Turkey will "hold the key" to what happens in Syria, where rebels backed by Ankara toppled the government of Bashar al-Assad earlier this month.
articles.title: Trump says Turkey holds the key to Syria's future
